description: A kingdom in the East Blue that was ravaged by a pirate attack 20 years before the main story. The Marines, including Bell-mère, fought to defend the kingdom in a brutal battle that left many dead and the village destroyed. This is where Bell-mère found baby Nami and young Nojiko among the ruins.

keyEvents.title: Bell-mère's First Appearance in Oykot Kingdom
keyEvents.description: Bell-mère lies wounded on the battlefield in the Oykot Kingdom, accepting her fate after the brutal war.
keyEvents.significance: The location where Bell-mère's life is transformed and Nami's story truly begins.

keyEvents.title: Discovery of Nami and Nojiko
keyEvents.description: Bell-mère discovers young Nojiko carrying baby Nami among the ruins of the war-torn kingdom.
keyEvents.significance: The pivotal moment that brings the three together and forms their family.

statusHistory.reason: Destroyed during war between Marines and pirates 20 years ago

description: A modest house on the outskirts of Cocoyasi Village where Bell-mère raised Nami and Nojiko. Despite their poverty, it was filled with love and became the home where the family shared many precious memories.

keyEvents.title: Family Meals at Bell-mère's House
keyEvents.description: Scenes of Bell-mère sacrificing her own meals to feed the girls, eating only mikans while giving them proper food.
keyEvents.significance: Symbolizes Bell-mère's selfless love and the family's struggle with poverty.

keyEvents.title: Nami's Argument with Bell-mère
keyEvents.description: The house where Nami has her regrettable argument with Bell-mère about not being her real mother.
keyEvents.significance: The site of Nami's last words to Bell-mère before tragedy strikes.

keyEvents.title: Smoke Rising from Bell-mère's House
keyEvents.description: Nami and Nojiko see smoke rising from their home as Arlong's crew conducts tribute collection.
keyEvents.significance: Foreshadows the tragic events that will unfold at the house in the next episode.

statusHistory.reason: Bell-mère's home where she raised Nami and Nojiko

name.japanese: ベルメールのみかん畑

description: The mikan (tangerine) farm operated by Bell-mère to support her family. Despite struggling with low mikan prices, she worked tirelessly to provide for Nami and Nojiko. After her death, Nojiko continues to maintain the farm.

keyEvents.title: Bell-mère Farming Mikans
keyEvents.description: Shows Bell-mère working the mikan farm to support her family despite financial hardship.
keyEvents.significance: The farm represents Bell-mère's hard work and dedication to her daughters. Mikans become a symbol of her love.

statusHistory.reason: Bell-mère's farm, later maintained by Nojiko

description: A peaceful village in the Conomi Islands where Nami was raised by Bell-mère. The village falls under Arlong's brutal rule and is forced to pay monthly tribute for 8 years.

keyEvents.title: Bell-mère Returns with Nami and Nojiko
keyEvents.description: Bell-mère returns from the war to Cocoyasi Village with two orphaned girls she plans to raise.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Cocoyasi Village as Nami's home and the setting for her childhood.

keyEvents.title: Arlong Pirates Invade Cocoyasi Village
keyEvents.description: Arlong and his crew arrive at Cocoyasi Village and declare it their territory.
keyEvents.significance: The beginning of 8 years of oppression that defines Nami's character.

keyEvents.title: Tribute System Announced
keyEvents.description: Arlong announces his brutal tribute system to the terrified villagers.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the economic oppression that enslaves the village.

statusHistory.reason: Under Arlong's control with tribute system

description: The headquarters of the Arlong Pirates, a fortress-like structure built on the Conomi Islands from which Arlong rules his territory.

keyEvents.title: Nojiko Tells Nami's Story at Arlong Park
keyEvents.description: In the present day, Nojiko recounts Nami's past to the Straw Hats at Arlong Park.
keyEvents.significance: The location where the crew learns the truth about Nami's suffering.
